result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Madison R. Modrow

defendant.name: Modrow, Madison R.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Madison R. Modrow not in court.  Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kate Drury, Present via phone.
Stmt. by the Court.
Stmt. by ADA request to amend bond to $2,000 signature with conditions
Court amends bond - covers 22CF236, 22CF237 & 22CF274
$2,000 signature bond with conditions - see bond
STC 9/26/22 at 9:00 a.m. 1970
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:47 AM
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Attorney Alex Gelhar - present.
Defendant - present (in custody)
Stmts by Atty. Gelhar - requests bond be modified to a signature bond.
Stmts by ADA Kurczewski - objects to the request.
Stmts by the Court.
The Court will leave the current bond in place, but will modify bond after treatment arrangements are made and provided to the Court.
STC: 8/2/2022 at 10:00am with 1970.
Bond Continued.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to the Court from the Defendant

ADA Kurczewski appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Atty. Gelhar.
Waiver of prelim. form filed.
The defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing in 22 CF 236 and 237.  Waivers accepted by the Court after rights were explained.
The state will file an information in each case consistent with the complaints.
Defendant acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same. Defendant stands mute.
The Court enters not guilty pleas on defendant's behalf in both cases.
Motion to modify bonds by Atty. Gelhar.
The state objects to bond modifications.
The Court denies the motion; bonds are continued.
Counsel to contact Br. 3 to scheduled STC.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADA Kurczewski appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared via video from the jail with Atty. Drury, who appeared remotely for today.
The defendant is eligible for SPD services.
The defendant has received copies of both criminal complaints, waives reading of same.
Statements by counsel.
The Court orders a $2000.00 cash bond, which covers both 22 CF 236 and 22 CF 237.
Conditions:  see bond.
Cases set for PH on 7-7-22 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 1 -- in person.
Cases set for RH on 7-6-22 at 10:00 a.m. in Br. 1 -- defendant may appear via Zoom if still in custody.
